title: 111_s1120

Summarized curr_chunk: 
Section 1 discusses the Hope and Lifetime Learning Credit. Section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses" and define it as expenses included in determining the cost of attendance at an eligible educational institution. Conforming amendments are made in Section 6050S. Section 6050S of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses" in various subsections. The effective date for these changes is expenses paid after December 31, 2008. SEC. 2 amends section 72(t)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code to define higher education expenses for education provided after December 31, 2008. SEC. 3 addresses qualified scholarships. SEC. 3 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to define "higher education expenses" for qualified scholarships. The amendments apply to amounts received after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4 amends the definition of "qualified higher education expenses" for income from US Savings Bonds. The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2008. SEC. 5 amends the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses to "higher education expenses" under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The definition of "higher education expenses" is aligned with section 25A(f) and the amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2008. SEC. 6 amends the definition of "qualified higher education expenses" under section 529(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2008.
